title: The academy skins make me wonder
body: What is it that prompts riot to give either a single champ a themed skin versus giving multiple champs a themed skin?  I'm glad the academy skins are coming out, they all look good for their price point.  However why are they on multiple champs when there are other themes that would look good on multiple champs but are relegated to a single one?

replies.body:
Currently lower scope skins are being designed in groups. We brainstorm a theme that could work on multiple champs (Dark/Light Knights, Dinosaurs, House of Cards, Academy) and then choose a bunch of champions that meet some criteria (work well with the theme, will look good without effects/animation support, haven't had a skin for a while). We do a rough spread of concepts of those champions and what they could look like then, based on those sketches, we choose the strongest skins from among them to go into production.

Higher scope skins like Star Guardian Lux require a lot more work from a bigger number of people. A group of 5 star guardians would require a huge amount of work and mean the team couldn't work on any other skins like Legendaries or Ultimates for a long time. So we can do it, but it's it's a big investment in a single theme so we'd have to be very confident that it's a theme a lot of players are going to enjoy.
So now that you guys know everybody loves star guardian lux... we will get more?

Okay, thank you Kindlejack.  Is it possible for riot to go back and add a theme like Star Guardian to someone else even if done one at a time?  It always feels like there's a few ideas that one champ has that would look great on some others but if it isn't a pool party, harrowing, or christmas skin, it's less likely to be ported over.

Yes it definitely is! You'll notice skin themes like Guardian of the Sands, Blood Moon, Arclight, Riot, Arcade, Battlecast etc. we revisit when it's a strong theme for a champion. I think it would be great to have at least 5 skins in each theme so you can field a matching team, although sometimes instead of aiming for a full team we give a certain skin to a certain role. For example Headhunter skins tend to be junglers, although with Caitlyn we did break that trend.
It is kind of hard not to do head hunter Caitlyn with that gun and that ult.  Might have been able to get away with head hunter Vayne as well since she can technically jungle.
I am fairly certain Headhunter Caitlyn developed out of a 'sci-fi' Caitlyn concept done at PAX Aus a couple of years ago. It felt like a good fit for the theme.

to be fair, nidalee wasn't a jungler as much as a top laner when that skin came out for her, and akali's more of a midlaner, so rengar's release and Yi are the only ones who 'really' are jungling headhunters (if that makes any sense)
Akali came after Caitlyn when the trend was already broken. Originally, because they were inspired by Predator, they were jungle champions as that is where Predator does his hunting.
